page.title: 19Mobile Services to Torridon
page.content: Weekdays,Royal Mail Post Bus makes a return journey between Diabaig and Kinlochewe uplifiting mail&passengers It is in Fasaig 10.30am returning at 3.30pm with incoming mail,passengers and the daily papers.Daily in summer; Mond.Wed.Frid.in winter, a mini bus from Shieldaig calls at Fasaig 9.45am & 2.45pm when it brings fresh bread & milk to the shop.Tuesdays;weekly am, a Mobile unit of The Bank of Scotland (this provides a valuable service,it is 30 miles to Gairloch,where the Bank is based),refuse collection:pm butcher van &fruit van.Wednesdays;monthly call from the Dingwall based Mobile Library Thursdays;fish van.Coal merchants call sometimes;a draper's van calls twice yearly.No business is done on Sundays. At one time coal and heavy goods were brought by sea,but now all goods come by rail then road, or by road.
